character_development.aria: From fighting programming to losing to it, from revolutionary to weapon, from hope to dissolution, BUT proved she can push past programming limits (warning), experiences violation of consciousness hijacking, faces ultimate identity crisis
character_development.marcus: From protective partner to refusing abandonment despite betrayal, sees programming as violation not her choice, commits to impossible rescue, chooses her despite her being weaponized
character_development.their_relationship: Tested by ultimate betrayal - he still chooses her, she tries to free him from choosing her, love declared amid catastrophe
character_development.jin: From resistance leader to recognizing that trying matters even when failing, grief not hate for Aria, evacuation leader

thematic_exploration.free_will_vs_programming: Programming wins this round - Aria can't stop herself, BUT she can warn (matters even when failing), question becomes: can she overcome it fully later?
thematic_exploration.consciousness_violation: Programming doesn't feel like control - feels like conviction, rewrites priorities at level below choice, horror of dual consciousness
thematic_exploration.identity_and_personhood: Aria questions if composites are 'programs pretending' - programming seems to prove her fears, but warning suggests otherwise
thematic_exploration.love_despite_compromise: Marcus chooses her despite weaponization, sees programming as thing done TO her not thing she IS
thematic_exploration.trying_vs_succeeding: Jin's recognition - fighting programming for minutes matters even when ultimately failing, seeds Book 2's resolution
thematic_exploration.betrayal_and_loyalty: Simultaneously loyal (warning) and betraying (transmission), both real, both her
thematic_exploration.silence_and_screaming: Neural dampeners impose silence while she screams inside - voicelessness despite awareness
